question.body: Variations in the size and shape of a personâ€™s nose is a result of:

multiple_choice.choice: The variations in the vomer bone.
The variation in the alar cartilages.
The variations in the olfactory mucosa.

response.feedback: Incorrect. The vomer bone is makes up part of the posterior nasal septum.
Correct. Variations in the alar cartilage at the tip of the nose and the septal cartilages account for the many variations in nose shapes and sizes.
Incorrect. Conchae are structures located in the nasal cavity that increase the surface area inside of the nose to improve the ability of the nose to warm and humidify the air coming into the body.
Incorrect. The olfactory mucosa are found in the roof of the nasal cavity and detect odors.
